thread.title: Why you should pity Sean Spicer
thread.title_full: Why you should pity Sean Spicer

author: Chris Cillizza
title: Why you should pity Sean Spicer
text:
Why you should pity Sean Spicer Chris Cillizza twitter TWEET More 
Serving as the White House press secretary is a famously difficult job. You are the front line of defence for the president and his administration, often taking the incoming heat from reporters day after day because, well, that's the job. There's a reason, after all, that a flak jacket is your ceremonial welcome gift. 
So, Sean Spicer, President Trump's press secretary, knew what he was getting into when he took the position. But there's no way he could have known it would be this bad. Tom Hiddleston mimics Chris Hemsworth Play Video Sean Spicer responds to SNL skit Sean Spicer responds to SNL skit 
Melissa McCarthy's SNL impression of the press secretary has gone viral, and Sean Spicer gives his reaction to the skit to a Fox News reporter. Up Next Tom Hiddleston mimics Chris Hemsworth Play Video Tom Hiddleston mimics Chris Hemsworth 
The British actor picks up on the Australian accent after hanging in Brisbane while shooting Thor: Ragnarok . Up Next Patrick Swayze's leather jacket up for sale Play Video Patrick Swayze's leather jacket up for sale 
Along with other memorabilia, the jacket Patrick Swayze wore in Dirty Dancing is up for auction. Up Next Rolf Harris found not guilty Play Video Rolf Harris found not guilty Rolf Harris found not guilty 
After a London-based trial, Rolf Harris is found not guilty of three sexually-related charges and could be out on parole by June. Vision courtesy ABC News 24 Up Next Melissa McCarthy nails Sean Spicer Play Video Melissa McCarthy nails Sean Spicer Melissa McCarthy nails Sean Spicer 
Melissa McCarthy's impression of press secretary Sean Spicer looks set to become a regular feature on Saturday Night Live. Up Next The Oscar for the most awkward photo goes to ... Play Video The Oscar for the most awkward photo goes ... The Oscar for the most awkward photo goes to ... 
Mel Gibson, Ryan Gosling, Nicole Kidman, Emma Stone and more pose for the annual group photo at the Oscar Nominees Luncheon. Up Next Tziporah: 'Everyone is terrified of James Packer' Play Video Tziporah: 'Everyone is terrified of James ... Tziporah: 'Everyone is terrified of James Packer' 
He's notoriously private, but James Packer's ex-fiance Tziporah Malkah (previously known as Kate Fischer) is revealing a side to the billionaire that has never been heard of before. Vision: Network 10 . Up Next Jackie Chan's emotional tribute Jackie Chan's emotional tribute 
Surprised by seeing members of his stunt team from the beginning of his career, Jackie Chan can't hold back the tears. More videos Sean Spicer responds to SNL skit 
Melissa McCarthy's SNL impression of the press secretary has gone viral, and Sean Spicer gives his reaction to the skit to a Fox News reporter. 
Spicer is taking the usual slings and arrows from reporters. And he has been spoofed — brilliantly — on "Saturday Night Live." Neither of those things have made his job miserable, however. That honour goes to the constant leaking out of the White House that suggests Trump is less than enamoured with how Spicer looks, how he sounds and how he is doing the job. 
The latest piece of friendly fire came Tuesday night from CNN in a piece headlined: " White House ramping up search for communications director after Spicer's rocky start ." There's a bunch of brutal quotes in the piece. Here's a sampling: Related Content Sean Spicer says SNL should stop being 'mean' after hilarious skit 
* White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus "vouched for Spicer and against Trump's instincts. The president 'regrets it every day and blames Priebus,' " one source close to the hiring process told CNN's Jim Acosta. 
* "Multiple sources have told CNN that Spicer was not Trump's first choice for press secretary. White House counsellor Kellyanne Conway was offered the position but turned it down." Advertisement 
* "A source familiar with internal communications said President Donald Trump is disappointed in Spicer's performance during the first two weeks of the administration." 
It's a rough read. Particularly when you consider that a) Spicer has been on the job for just a few weeks and b) this is far from the first story in which Trump's dissatisfaction with Spicer has been made plain. SHARE
